(B) The addresses are those of the nursing homes. (C) The fees for nursing homes approved under the National Health Act (other than Government nursing homes) are gross fees for ordinary care pauents. The patient's liability to meet these fees from his own resources is reduced by the amount of Commonwealth and nursing home fund benefits payable. For intensive nursing home care patients fees and benefits are $21 a week higher. (D) Nursing homes classified as Government nursing homes are not subject to Commonwealth fee control. (E) Nursing homes approved under the Nursing Homes Assistance Aa are deficitfinancedby the Commonwealth Government and this takes the place of Commonwealth benefits which otherwise would be paid in respea of each patient to assist in meeting fees paid. The $47.10 shown as the fee is the statutory patient contribution.
